description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (s73) to vary condition 15 (opening hours) of planning application ref: P/2000/1753 dated 23.08.2000 for 'Refurbishment, external alterations and part single / two storey extensions to sports centre. Re-arrangement of external playing fields (cricket field,cricket nets, six 5 aside football pitches and eight tennis courts) with boundary fencing,landscaping and temporary changing rooms and car parking'. Variation seeking to extend opening hours for a temporary 30-day period each year during Ramadan to 0200 hours Monday to Sunday for a temporary 5-year period up until 2022.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission P/2000/1753 dated 23/08/2000.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the materials of the external surface of the development submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: 21595/20/J (P/2001/4061) dated 15/01/2002. | The car parking space(s) shown on the approved plan 8720/P006 Rev. B shall be marked out on the site and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.
Reason: to ensure there is adequate provision for car parking within the site.

| Any machinery audible outside the premises must be designed to be an acoustic standard not exceeding Noise Rating NR35 measured or calculated at the nearest horizontal or vertical boundary of the nearest affected dwelling, whichever is the closer.
Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers.

| Condition superseded by planning permission P/2005/0778, allowed at appeal (APP/A5270/A/05/1179649) on 02/02/2006. | Condition deleted by planning permission P/2005/0778, allowed at appeal (APP/A5270/A/05/1179649) on 02/02/2006. | Condition superseded by planning permission P/2005/0778, allowed at appeal (APP/A5270/A/05/1179649) on 02/02/2006. | The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the permanent changing facilities submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: 21595/20/H (P/2001/2610) dated 15/01/2002. | The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the floodlighting submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: P/2001/1200 dated 08/11/2001. | The floodlights shall only be used between 0830 and 2200 hours Monday to Friday and 0830 to 2030 hours on Saturday Sunday and Bank Holidays. Such floodlights to be switched off immediately thereafter. Reason: To protect living conditions of adjoining residents. | The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the vertical luminance of lighting submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: P/2001/1201 dated 08/11/2001. | The six proposed new five a side football pitches, the cricket field and cricket nets, and the eight tennis courts adjacent to the Sports Centre shall not be used outside the hours of 0830 and 2200 hours Monday to Friday and 0830 to 2030 hours on Saturday Sunday and Bank Holidays. | The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the building structure's insulation submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: 21595/20/M (P/2002/0040) dated 05/03/2002.

| Condition superseded by planning permission P/2005/0778, allowed at appeal (APP/A5270/A/05/1179649) on 02/02/2006. | The leisure centre shall not be used outside the hours of 0600 to 2300 hours Monday to Friday and 0700 to 2300 hours on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank or Public Holidays, except for a temporary 30-day period each year during Ramadan when opening hours will be extended to 0200 hours Monday to Sunday for a temporary 5-year period up until 2022.
Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties.

| The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the dustbin and enclosed refuse areas submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: 21595/20/I (P/2001/4060) dated 09/07/2002. | Condition superseded by planning permission P/2005/0778, allowed at appeal (APP/A5270/A/05/1179649) on 02/02/2006. | The service bay areas as indicated on the approved plan 8720 P/006revB shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these shall be continuously kept available for loading, unloading and manoeuvring areas shall be kept clear at all times and used for these purposes only.
Reason: To ensure that adequate parking and servicing is available within the site.

| The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the dustbin and enclosed refuse areas submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: 21595/20/G (P/2001/2556) dated 15/01/2002. | The car park hereby permitted for use by Virgin Active members and Pay As You Play users, as shown on drawing 22257 02 J, shall only be used as an overspill car park, accommodating no more than 50 additional parking spaces. | The Pay As You Play car park, as shown on drawing number 22257 02 J, shall accommodate no more than 21 cars and shall only be used by customers of the Pay As You Play facilities. | The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the Green Travel Plan submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: P/2006/1117 dated 03/11/2006. | The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the Landscape Management Plan submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: P/2006/1120 dated 21/08/2006. | The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the screen of trees and shrubs submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: P/2006/2500 dated 12/09/2006. | The existing screen planting around the relocated Pay As You Play courts P4 and P5, as shown on drawing number 22257 02 J, shall be retained. Any trees, shrubs or other plants, which within a period of 5 years from the date of this permission die, are removed, or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season with other of similar size and species, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation. | The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the boundary treatments submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: P/2006/2223 dated 21/08/2006. | The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the external lighting submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: P/2006/2223 dated 21/08/2006. | No floodlights or other form of artificial lighting shall be installed around or within the relocated Pay As You Play courts P4 and P5, as shown on drawing number 22257 02 J.

| No cars or other vehicles shall be parked on the site other than within the approved parking areas, as shown on drawing number 22257 02 J. No vehicles shall be parked on any of the access roads within the site (other than to set down or collect patrons/visitors to the site). | The area designated as a coach parking area outside the main entrance of the Virgin Active building, as shown on drawing number 22257 02 E, is to be re-designated for 5 Mother and Baby car parking spaces and is to be made available for coach parking when required, subject to prior notice. | The 5 parking bays designated for disabled drivers outside the main entrance of the Virgin Active building, as shown on drawing number 22257 02 J, shall marked out for disabled drivers and retained thereafter for that use. | No football is to be played on the relocated Pay As You Play courts P4 and P5 without the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.
